revised_title: Nitrogen Conservation and the Green Hydra Symbiosis: Maltose Release and Essential Amino Acid Conservation
tldr: The study investigates the green hydra symbiosis and its role in nitrogen conservation. It suggests that the release of maltose by symbiotic algae enables the host to conserve essential amino acids. The research also examines the feeding rates and composition of prey in a natural population of green hydra, as well as the source of ammonium released by the animals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Symbiosis and Nitrogen Recycling
